CHAPTER 7 
AI SYSTEM IMPLEMENTATION
 
91 
low CER, high accuracy model that‚Äôs well trained to recognize Arabic 
Alphabetical Letters. This success prompted us to further enhance the 
model's capabilities by transferring its learned weights to the main 
KHATT Dataset, which comprises 50,145 samples. By fine-tuning the 
model on this larger and more diverse dataset, we aim to capitalize on 
the features and patterns learned from the Arabic Alphabet dataset, 
thereby improving the model's accuracy and robustness for recognizing 
handwritten Arabic text in the KHATT Dataset. This application of 
transfer learning allows us to efficiently adapt the model to new data 
while leveraging existing knowledge to achieve superior performance in 
a related domain. 
 
 
Figure 7.9: Demonstrating Transfer Learning Technique 
 
7.3.4 Final Results 
 
 
In our final approach, we loaded the ResNet50V2 model pre-
trained on the Arabic Alphabet Character dataset and continued training 
on the main KHATT Dataset using advanced techniques and optimal 
hyperparameters. The model was trained with a cosine learning rate 
scheduler, Adam optimizer with an initial learning rate of 0.001, ùõÉ1 of 0.9, 
ùõÉ2 of 0.999, and Œµ set to 1 x e-7, across 70 epochs.
